newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Sulzer sees strong rise in 1997 profit.
newsitem.headline: Sulzer sees strong rise in 1997 profit.

text.p: Swiss diversified manufacturing company Sulzer AG said it expected net profit to rise strongly in 1997.
"For the current business year, Sulzer expects a strong rise in group net profit," it said in a statement without elaborating.

Chief executive Fritz Fahrni said in a statement that innovation, new services and stronger customer orientation as well as strict cost management would lead to significantly improved operating and net profit in 1997.
"New orders in the first two months were a pleasing nine percent higher than in the comparative period," Fahrni said in the text of a speech released before a news conference.
Chief financial officer Erich Mueller said Sulzer expected a positive effect on 1997 results from the weaker Swiss franc and stronger dollar exchange rates of recent months.

"The effect of all exchange rate changes on the operating result (in 1996) was five million Swiss francs. We hope that a positive influence will take effect in 1997," he said in the prepared text of his speech.
